Txt_Talk_Dharma_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0910_010.Text: *: Head far to the east of the abbey and eventually you will reach an inn by the coast.
*: From there, one can gaze upon the islands of Jipang<--->it is a nation positively shrouded in mystery.

Txt_Talk_Dharma_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_1010_010.Text: *: Ever 'eard o' the village of Mur? Easiest way to get there is to look for this inn by the east coast. Once you find that, 'ead way up north and you'll be there soon enuff.
*: Can't say it's exactly the liveliest o' places, but it's well worf a visit if you ask me.

Txt_Talk_Dharma_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_0110_010_.Text: *: I'm thinking of becoming a martial artist. Haaai-YAH!!!

Txt_Talk_Dharma_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_0210_010_.Text: *: I'm going to become a merchant and make an absolute mint!

Txt_Talk_Dharma_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_0310_010_.Text: *: I want to become a mage! Abracadabraaa!

Txt_Talk_Dharma_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_0410_010_.Text: *: I'm going to become a beautiful, fresh-faced young damsel! Tee hee hee!

Txt_Talk_Dharma_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_0610_010_.Text: *: If you choose a new vocation, you'll lose all the experience you've earned in your old one.
*: But all the effort you've made won't have been for nothing<--->you'll see some benefits in your new job.
*: That being said, a priest who becomes a warrior, then decides to go back to being a priest will have to start again from level 1.
*: So you don't want to go changing vocations too often.
*: But if you do, you'll find that you level up quite quickly, so it shouldn't be that much of a problem.

Txt_Talk_Dharma_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_0710_010_.Text: *: If a mage becomes a warrior, they'll be a warrior who can use magic. Good, eh?
*: But they'll also be back at level 1, so don't change your whole party's vocations at once, or you'll be in trouble.
*: You're probably best off changing one or two people's vocations at a time.
*: If it's your first time, I'd recommend something like priest to martial artist, or warrior to priest.
*: That'll give you two characters with healing spells<--->and your martial artist will be able to cast them nice and quick.

Txt_Talk_Dharma_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_0810_010_.Text: *: Hmm? Why yes, I do supply a merchant in Baharata with black pepper from time to time, but what business is that of yours?
*: Oh, are you a friend of Gopal's? Then you are a friend of mine as well! I'll give you as much pepper as you need.
*: Here you go. I hope it's to your liking.
*: It's a fair trek from Baharata to here, isn't it? Not made any easier when you have to do it hauling pouches upon pouches of pepper...

Txt_Talk_Dharma_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_0910_010_.Text: *: I once heard there's this place in the mountains to the north of here called the Tower of Transcendence.
*: Apparently, it used to be frequented by martial artists wanting to really hone their craft.
*: What's more, the top level of the tower is home to hardy monsters that are worth their weight in gold if you best them in battle.
*: Hmm? Why I'm talking about metal slimes, of course! Go and have a look yourself if you've got the time.
*: As it happens, I'm thinking of changing vocations myself... What do I want to be? A warrior, obviously!
*: I need to do some training of my own first though if I'm going to walk the walk. Maybe I'll see if I can't track down those metal slimes too...

Txt_Talk_Dharma_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_1010_010_.Text: *: It appears I have no choice but to take on a new vocation if I wish to reach my true potential.
*: The question is: what should I become? Perhaps I will try my hand at being a gadabout. You don't see too many with muscles like mine after all!

Txt_Talk_Dharma_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_1110_010_.Text: *: Hmm? You wish to know why changing vocations is beneficial? Well, broadly speaking, there are two main reasons it is so.
*: Firstly, one can learn a far greater number of spells and abilities, which they will never forget even if they change vocations again.
*: Finally, pursuing a new path allows one to fundamentally improve one's own attributes. At least, that is the belief we subscribe to here at the abbey.

Txt_Talk_Dharma_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_1210_010_.Text: *: I just don't know if I'm ready to go through with it... All my friends got so weak right after they took up new vocations.
*: I mean, they were alright in the end<--->their more powerful pals carried them through a few fights, and they got back to their old brawny selves soon enough.
*: It's just... Well, I'm a bit of a lone wolf, as it happens, so I can't really afford that luxury.

Txt_Talk_Dharma_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_1310_010_.Text: *: People here sometimes mention a one-time warrior who really made the most of the abbey.
*: Apparently, he first changed vocations to become a mage, then took on the mantle of a thief before going back to being a warrior.
*: Actually, I suppose he wasn't a one-time warrior after all... A two-time wa<---> You know what? Never mind.

Txt_Talk_Dharma_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_1410_010_.Text: *: Supposedly, long, long ago a group of martial artists used the abbey as both their home and training ground to hone their skills.
*: Though, as with all hearsay, you have to take these things with a pinch of salt.
*: That said, it would go some way to explaining how the abbey came to be the go-to place for changing vocations.

Txt_Talk_Dharma_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_1510_010_.Text: *: Goddess, give me patience... Now, for the hundredth time, the effects of Kabuff and Kasap will increase each time you cast them up to a maximum of two to three times. However, Oomph is only worth casting once.
*: You are more than capable of remembering this much. Do not do yourself down.

Txt_Talk_Dharma_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_1610_010_.Text: *: I know, I know... Alright, so I should cast Buff, Sap and Acceleratle two to three times, but Oomph just the once. Oh, and Magic Barrier's only worf casting once too, I suppose...

Txt_Talk_Dharma_1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_1710_010_.Text: *: There are monsters out there that aren't aggressive at all, but unless a monster wrangler approaches them, they'll usually just run away.
*: So if you spot a friendly creature that might need looking after, be sure to have a monster wrangler in your ranks before trying to befriend it.

Txt_Talk_Dharma_B1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_0310_010.Text: *: There's an island off the coast to the south-east of here named Jipang. They call it the Golden Country.
*: It sounds amazing. Wouldn't it be great to sail there and see what it's like?

Txt_Talk_Dharma_B1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_0320_010.Text: *: Ah-phew... Ah-phew... And how may I help you today, sir...? Mmm...

Txt_Talk_Dharma_B1F_SUB_0_ACTOR_0620_010.Text: *: Zzz... Oh, stop it! Tee hee! I know I'm gorgeous, but there's no need to fight over me! Mmm... (sigh) Zzz...

Txt_Talk_Dharma_Out_SUB_0_ACTOR_0810_010.Text: *: As part of my training, I have taken to consuming poisonous foods to build up resistance to various toxins.
*: I have it on good authority that poisonous mushroom-like monsters inhabit the area around a cave to the south of here. Perhaps that is where I should head next...

Txt_Talk_Dharma_Out_SUB_0_VOLUME_0430_01.Text: {LEADER} calms the monster with a soothing voice and tells it about Monty's monster menagerie...
